instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: [SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message:
hello, i just working on that machine.

it has no backlight. with a lamp behind the apple logo i can see its working. i tryed to brighten up the display in osx but its full bright.

i found a bridged F9700 !

i pulled <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and there were 2 shorts (pin4-5) and (pin2-3)

after soldering a new one

still no backlight

feedback trace is not burned.

lvds connector replaced with a good one, only to be shure

pin 32 LVDS connector has 12.5 V only 


and it seems that the gpu (untouched) is getting very warm

5V, 3.3V on <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> is there

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3,45V


display tryed with another board is working. need some help please.

thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
[SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message:
No Title

yes,
it has 0.09V

the signal loooks a little bit not nice




the <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> is switching from 1.12 to 0.91 during the gong so the gbu what i thought should be working

threads.title: [SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: 0.09V is of course way too low. Remove <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and inject 3V directly, could be dead <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> pulling it down.

threads.title: [SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message:
thanks.

so direct injecting without <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> is working good backlight

I measured <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> it has 42Ohm a little bit to much
I measured <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> Pin 1 in diode mode is short to gnd

pulled out still <RESISTOR>R9693</RESISTOR> but still shorted. so that means the GMUX is killed?

(under <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> was a short between pin 4 and 5, so the <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> from the GMUX was directly connected to <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL>)

threads.title: [SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: MUX is dead. Just leave PWM connected to 3V, just no brightness control.

threads.title: [SOLVED]another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight
threads.message: i offered my custom that but he want to have brightness control. I replaced the MUX and its working everything like it should. so the case can be closed. Thanks for you help.
